text: Katsukawa Shunsho_ founded the Katsukawa School whose artists specialized in depictions of Kabuki actors. Nevertheless, Shunsho_ was a prolific and versatile artist. Here he depicted two women lounging by an open sliding door (<I>shoji<I>). One has laid aside her <I>shamisen<I> (three-stringed zither) to smoke a long, elegant pipe. A smoking set has been placed on the veranda nearby. The other woman concentrates on writing a love letter with brush and ink. The sweet elegance of the women's countenances and their meticulously rendered robes are hallmarks of Shunsho_'s style.
title: Two Courtesans Writing a Letter
